New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became the 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0.
The Cavaliers ended their NBA-record streak of scoring 110 points in 10 consecutive wins to open a season.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley had 23 points and 16 rebounds.
Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter.
Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws.
Cam Johnson scored 23 points for the Nets.
Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas each scored 22 points for the Nets.
Brooklyn trailed by 15 in the second quarter but held Cleveland to a season-low 13 points in the third quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 2015-16 Golden State Warriors hold the league record after winning their first 24 games.
Hall of Fame centre Wilt Chamberlain and the 1960-61 Philadelphia Warriors had held the mark with nine consecutive games scoring 110 points.
